Diagnostic Steps: Check bearing clearance and rotation|Inspect impeller for deformation or foreign objects|Check coupling alignment and tightness
Solution: Replace bearings|Clean or replace impeller|Realign and tighten coupling
Preventive Measures: Regular lubrication|Regular impeller inspection|Regular coupling alignment check

Possible Causes: Power phase loss|Emergency stop button pressed|Main circuit breaker tripped
Diagnostic Steps: Check if three-phase power is normal|Check if all emergency stop buttons are reset|Check if main circuit breaker tripped and reset
Solution: Restore power supply|Reset emergency stop button|Reset main circuit breaker
Preventive Measures: Regular power line inspection|Train employees on correct emergency stop operation

Possible Causes: Sensor damage|I/O module fault|Program logic error
Diagnostic Steps: Check sensor readings for accuracy|Check I/O module indicator lights and wiring|Inspect PLC program logic
Solution: Replace or calibrate sensor|Replace I/O module|Modify PLC program and retest
Preventive Measures: Regular sensor calibration|Regular module health check|Code review and testing

Possible Causes: Oil seal aging|Piston rod wear|Loose pipe fittings
Diagnostic Steps: Check oil seal wear condition|Inspect piston rod surface for smoothness|Check if all pipe fittings are tight
Solution: Replace oil seal|Replace piston rod or hydraulic cylinder|Tighten or replace pipe fittings
Preventive Measures: Regular oil seal replacement|Regular piston rod surface inspection

Possible Causes: Program logic error|Encoder fault|Controller parameter misconfiguration
Diagnostic Steps: Check robot program logic|Check if encoder signals are normal|Check controller parameter settings
Solution: Modify program and retest|Replace encoder|Reset controller parameters
Preventive Measures: Code review and testing|Regular encoder inspection|Regular backup and validation of controller parameters
